newsitem.title: USA: US consumer confidence 113.8 in Dec vs rvsd 109.5.
newsitem.headline: US consumer confidence 113.8 in Dec vs rvsd 109.5.

text.p: The index of U.S. consumer confidence jumped to 113.8 in December, up from a revised reading of 109.5 in November, the Conference Board said on Tuesday.

The expectations component of the December index advanced more than five points to 98.8 from a revised 93.5 in the previous month, and the present situation component rose to 136.4 versus a revised reading of 133.4 in November.

"Consumer confidence is up dramatically over the last 12 months, suggesting that consumer demand will help pave the way for a healthy economy during the first half of 1997," Lynn Franco, associate director of the Conference Board's Consumer Research Center, said in a statement.
The Consumer confidence report said that "consumers are more positive now than they were in November, with nearly 29 percent saying that jobs are plentiful, up from less than 27 percent in November."
Less than 6 percent of surveyed households said they are looking for a slowdown in economic activity, the report said.
